name: pyrinoline
source: Bergstrom C. A. S.; Norinder U.; Luthman K.; Artursson P. Molecular Descriptors Influencing Melting Point and Their Role in Classification of Solid Drugs. J. Chem. Inf. Comput. Sci.; (Article); 2003; 43(4); 1177-1432
Reason: 1,3-Dimethylpyrrolidine has a melting point of approximately 100 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for this compound can be considered pyrrolidine, which has a melting point of around 50 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in pyrinoline will affect its melting point: (1) The methyl groups (1,3-dimethyl) add approximately +10 due to increasing the molecular weight and rigidity of the structure; (2) The pyrrole ring (C1=CC(C=C1)=C) adds roughly +20 due to adding more rigidity and planarity to the structure; (3) The methylene bridge (c2ccccn2) adds approximately +10 due to increasing the molecular weight and rigidity of the structure; (4) The ethylene bridge (c3ccccn3) adds roughly +5 due to increasing the molecular weight and rigidity of the structure; (5) The methylene bridge (c4ccccn4) adds approximately +10 due to increasing the molecular weight and rigidity of the structure; (6) The ethylene bridge (c5ccccn5) adds roughly +5 due to increasing the molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
